criteria.desc: Explicitly identifies single-stage current-mirror OTA with high-swing output path.
States GBW ≈ (gm/CL) multiplied by the mirror ratio k from the inner 5T core to the output devices: GBW ≈ (gm/CL)·k.
Mentions dominant single pole, β≈1, matching in mirrors, neglects higher-order poles from mirrors for first-order GBW.
Defines a current gain from the diode-connected PMOS in the inner 5T load to the output PMOS/NMOS devices (left branch mirrored through NMOS, right branch directly to vout).
Cites real elements (e.g., M1/M2 for gm, CL, M5/M6/M8 for mirror path).
Avoids asserting parts that don't exist (no hallucinated IDs).
